\n\nTomato Egg Skillet@Mon Dec 04 22:24:.recipe:
Ingredients:
1 Tomato
2 Eggs
1/4 teaspoon Salt
1/4 teaspoon Pepper
1 tablespoon Olive Oil

Instructions:
1. Start by heating olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. 
2. Cut the tomato into quarter slices and add them to the skillet. 
3. Cook the tomato slices until lightly browned. 
4. Crack the eggs into a bowl, then add salt and pepper to the eggs. 
5. Add the egg mixture to the skillet and reduce the heat to medium-low. 
6. Stir the egg and tomato until the eggs are cooked and there are no raw egg pieces visible. 
7. Serve the egg and tomato dish hot. Enjoy!
\n\nTomato Egg Skillet@Mon Dec 04 22:24:.title: Tomato Egg Skillet

\n\nCheesy Apple Breakfast Bake@Tue Dec.recipe:
Ingredients:

- 4 ounces of cheese (grated)
- 2 apples (chopped)
- 1/4 cup of butter
- 2 tablespoons of honey
- 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon
- 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons of whole wheat flour
- 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder
-1/4 teaspoon of salt

Recipe:

1. Preheat oven to 350°F.

2. In a medium bowl, combine butter, honey, cinnamon, all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, and salt, and mix until a dough forms.

3. Grease an 8×8-inch pan with butter or cooking spray.

4. Place the dough into the pan and spread it until it covers the entire bottom.

5. Top the dough with the grated cheese and chopped apples in an even layer.

6. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

7. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving. Enjoy!
\n\nCheesy Apple Breakfast Bake@Tue Dec.title: Cheesy Apple Breakfast Bake

\n\nCheesy Scramble Eggs@Tue Dec 05 14:3.recipe:
Ingredients: 
- 4 large eggs 
- 2 cups of shredded cheese

Instructions: 

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F.

2. Grease a 9-inch pie dish with butter or oil and set aside.

3. Beat the eggs in a medium-sized bowl until they’re light and fluffy.

4. Add the shredded cheese to the eggs and mix.

5. Pour the egg and cheese mixture into the prepared pie dish.

6. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

7. Serve and enjoy!
\n\nCheesy Scramble Eggs@Tue Dec 05 14:3.title: Cheesy Scramble Eggs

\n\nChicken and Egg Frittata@Tue Dec 05.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts 
- 2 hard boiled eggs 
- 2 scallions 
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise 
- 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard 
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil 
- 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar
- Salt and pepper to taste

Recipe: 

1. Preheat the oven to 350F.

2. Cut chicken breasts into cubes and season with salt and pepper.

3. Heat a tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the cubed chicken and cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes.

4. In a medium bowl, dice the hard boiled eggs and scallions.

5. Add the mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, and white wine vinegar to the bowl. Mix until ingredients are combined.

6. Place the cooked chicken in an oven-safe dish.

7. Pour the egg and mayonnaise mixture over the chicken and mix until ingredients are combined.

8. Place in the oven and bake for 25 minutes.

9. Serve and enjoy!
\n\nChicken and Egg Frittata@Tue Dec 05.title: Chicken and Egg Frittata

\n\nSlow-Cooked Barbecue Ribs@Tue Dec 05.recipe:
Ingredients:
1 rack of ribs
1 bottle of BBQ sauce
1/4 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup vegetable oil
2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
2 tablespoons garlic powder
1 teaspoon black pepper

Instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F.

2. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.

3. Place the rack of ribs on the baking sheet.

4. In a bowl, combine the BBQ sauce, brown sugar, vegetable oil, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, and black pepper. Stir to combine.

5. Brush the mixture evenly over both sides of the ribs, making sure each rib is completely covered.

6. Bake the ribs in the preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes, until tender and cooked through.

7. Serve while hot. Enjoy!
\n\nSlow-Cooked Barbecue Ribs@Tue Dec 05.title: Slow-Cooked Barbecue Ribs

\n\nBacon and Ham Sandwich@Mon Dec 04 22.recipe:
Ingredients needed:
1-4 slices of Bacon 
1-2 slices of Ham 
2 slices of Bread 
Optional:
Mayonnaise
Mustard

Instructions:
1. Heat up the skillet on medium heat. 
2. Lay the bacon strips in the skillet and cook until both sides are lightly browned. 
3. After the bacon is done, set it aside and add the ham to the same skillet. 
4. Cook the ham until lightly browned, flipping it over once during the cooking process. 
5. Toast the two slices of bread in a toaster or a toaster oven.
6. Assemble the sandwich by spreading a thin layer of mayonnaise and/or mustard (one or both depending on preference) on each slice of bread.
7. Place the bacon and ham on one slice of bread and top it off with the other slice of bread. 
8. Enjoy your bacon and ham sandwich!
\n\nBacon and Ham Sandwich@Mon Dec 04 22.title: Bacon and Ham Sandwich

\n\nSpicy Chicken Stir-Fry@Tue Dec 05 15.recipe:
Ingredients

-1 lb. of Chicken Breasts, cubed
-1/4 cup Olive Oil
-1/4 teaspoon of Salt
-1/4 teaspoon of Ground Black Pepper
-2 cloves of Garlic, minced
-2 tablespoons of chopped Parsley
-1/4 cup of dry White Wine
-1/4 cup of Red Wine Vinegar
-1/4 cup of Dijon Mustard
-1/4 cup of Honey

Instructions

1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.

2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken cubes with the olive oil, salt, black pepper, garlic, parsley, white wine, red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, and honey. Gently mix until the chicken is evenly coated with the marinade.

3. Transfer the marinated chicken to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.

4. Bake in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165 degrees Fahrenheit.

5. Serve the baked chicken with your favorite side dish. Enjoy!
\n\nSpicy Chicken Stir-Fry@Tue Dec 05 15.title: Spicy Chicken Stir-Fry

\n\nCoffee-Infused Breakfast Surprise@Tu.recipe:
Ingredients:
1 scoop of instant coffee
1 cup of semi-skimmed milk
1 ½ tsp of coconut oil
4 tablespoons of oats
1 banana
1 teaspoon of chia seeds

Instructions:
1. In a small bowl, mix the instant coffee with the semi-skimmed milk and set aside.

2. In a saucepan, heat the coconut oil over medium heat for a minute or two.

3. Once the oil is hot, add the oats and toast for a few minutes, stirring regularly.

4. Once the oats are toasted, reduce the heat to low and add the coffee-milk mixture to the oats and stir until all the liquid has been absorbed.

5. Slice the banana and add it to the oats.

6. Add the chia seeds and stir to combine.

7. Cook for a few minutes on low heat until all the ingredients are heated through and the oats are tender.

8. Serve and enjoy!
\n\nCoffee-Infused Breakfast Surprise@Tu.title: Coffee-Infused Breakfast Surprise

\n\nSavory Peppered Chicken@Tue Dec 05 1.recipe:
Ingredients: 
- Bell peppers
- Medium onion
- Garlic cloves
- Ground cumin
- Ground coriander
- Chili powder
- Vegetable broth
- Olive oil
- Quinoa
- Green peas
- Salt 

Instructions: 
1. Preheat oven to 425°F and lightly grease a large baking sheet with olive oil.

2. Cut two bell peppers into small pieces and place them on the baking sheet. Sprinkle with some salt. Bake in oven for 15-20 minutes until lightly golden.

3. In a large pot on medium heat, add a tablespoon of olive oil and one sliced onion. Cook for 5 minutes until onions are fragrant and translucent.

4. Add four minced garlic cloves and stir for one minute.

5. Add one teaspoon of ground cumin, ground coriander, and chili powder, and cook for another minute.

6. Add in one cup of vegetable broth and one cup of quinoa. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to low. Let the quinoa simmer for 20 minutes.

7. After the quinoa is cooked, add in one cup of green peas, the roasted bell peppers, and salt to taste. Cook for an additional 5 minutes. 

8. Serve and enjoy.
\n\nSavory Peppered Chicken@Tue Dec 05 1.title: Savory Peppered Chicken

\n\nCheesy Egg Delight@Tue Dec 05 15:20:.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 2 tablespoons grated cheese
- 2 tablespoons milk
- Salt and pepper, to taste

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F.
2. Grease an oven-safe skillet with cooking spray.
3. Whisk eggs in a bowl until well mixed.
4. Pour eggs into the skillet.
5. Sprinkle grated cheese over the eggs.
6. Pour milk into the skillet.
7. Sprinkle salt and pepper, to taste.
8. Bake eggs in the oven for 12-15 minutes, until cooked through.
9. Remove skillet from oven and serve.
\n\nCheesy Egg Delight@Tue Dec 05 15:20:.title: Cheesy Egg Delight

\n\nSavory Tofu Stir-Fry@Tue Dec 05 15:2.recipe:
Ingredients:
- Tofu (one package) 
- Onion (one small) 
- Bell pepper (one) 
- Garlic (one clove) 
- Ginger (one teaspoon freshly grated)
- Soy sauce (2 tablespoons) 
- Sesame oil (1 tablespoon) 
- Rice or quinoa (for serving) 

Instructions:

1. Slice the tofu into cubes and set aside.

2. Dice the onion and bell pepper and mince the garlic.

3. Heat a large skillet with a tablespoon of vegetable oil over medium heat and add the diced onion. Sauté until softened, about 3 minutes.

4. Add the bell pepper, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and sesame oil, and stir to combine. Cook for two minutes.

5. Add the diced tofu and stir to combine. Continue cooking for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tofu is nicely browned and cooked through.

6. Serve the tofu mixture with rice or quinoa.
\n\nSavory Tofu Stir-Fry@Tue Dec 05 15:2.title: Savory Tofu Stir-Fry
